title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: J. H. Remington to Orlando Brown, June 18, 1866
summary: Remington files his quarterly report about conditions in the 6th District. Regarding Augusta County, he comments on the low wages earned by black laborers, the inability to receive justice in the civil courts, the progress being made in registering married couples and the flourishing condition of the schools. He also comments on George Cook's abilities as Agent.
